text:
I've just upgraded from the official jakarta tomcat-3.3-b1 rpm to the
tomcat-3.3-b2 one and I've lost the output of System.err and  System.out in the
/var/log/tomcat.log logfile.
Is this change intentionnal ?
What are the prefered methods of webapp logging with tomcat 3.3 ?
creator: nicolas.mailhot@one2team.com

text:
I'm not sure what was the change, the RPM builds are slightly different. However
in case you are using /etc/rc.d scripts I think it is better to have the out and
err go to a file, since this could be called during system startup and the
output may be lost.

If you are using tomcat.sh, I believe you should have the output as before -
please reopen the bug if this is not the case.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
nicolas.mailhot@one2team.com
text:
I am using the /etc/rc.d scripts

The problem is, they used to redirect System.err and System.out to
/var/log/tomcat.log (they do so on another box where we still use tomcat
3.3-b1), but this no longuer works with tomcat 3.3b2.

So something did change in the rpm, but I can't figure what :(

creator: hgomez@slib.fr
text:
That's an error in RPM, will be fixed in Tomcat 3.3 rc1
RPM :)
